content:
• Thursday, December 29, 2016
  • MYL

    Mylan +2.2% as it launches generic version of ADHD drug Concerta

    • Mylan (MYL +0.5%) is up 2.2% after hours following news of the launch of a generic version of Janssen's Concerta tablets in the U.S.
    • The product, Methylphenidate Hydrochloride Extended-Release, is indicated for treating Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder.
    • The launch strengthens a "robust portfolio" of central nervous system medications, CEO Heather Bresch says.
    • The news is one of a string of new generics Mylan is announcing, including a generic version of Zovia tablets and a generic Cerebyx injection.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: MYL +2.1%. AG +1.2%. ALNY +1.2%. DB +0.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: LKSD -2.1%. ENDP -1.4%. FIS -1.3%. MFS -1.1%. BBRY -0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • INNL

    Innocoll gets refusal to file letter from FDA on XARACOLL; -52% after hours

    • Preliminary review by the U.S FDA ofÂ Innocoll's application labeled insufficient for substantive evaluation.
    • Further characterizes XARACOLL, the company's candidate for postsurgical pain treatment, a drug/device combination requiring submission of additional information.
    • Innocoll (NASDAQ:INNL) intends to request a Type A meeting with the FDA to address the various issues.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 9 Comments
  • VISN

    VisionChina -16.6%; Shareholders reject independent auditor

    • Shares of out-of-home ad firm VisionChina Media (NASDAQ:VISN) tanked into the close in U.S. trading, down 16.6%, and a reason may come in the company's postmarket release describing its annual general meeting.
    • Shareholders rejected the appointment of Marcum Bernstein & Pinchuk as the company's independent auditors.
    • The company says appointing Marcum BP had been recommended by the board but the two were unable to agree on commercial terms. The audit committee will seek to appoint a different auditing firm "as soon as practicable."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • QHC

    Quorum Health closes sale of Georgia hospital

    • Quorum Health (QHC -5.2%) has closed a sale of its hospital in Winder, Ga.
    • As of the New Year, the Barrow Regional Medical Center will transfer to Northeast Georgia Health System.
    • The move is the second divestiture for the company in the fourth quarter, and “We continue to focus on improving our financial and operational performance and are in active discussions on further divestiture opportunities," says CEO Thomas Miller.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • GEVO

    Gevo sets 1-for-20 reverse split for Jan. 5

    • Gevo (GEVO -6%) is off 3.8% after hours following the detailing of a 1-for-20 reverse stock split set for the close on Jan. 5.
    • Shares will begin trading on a split-adjusted basis on Friday, Jan. 6. The authorized share count will remain at 250M, and proportional adjustments will be made to all conversion/exercise prices.
    • Fractional shares will be rounded up.
    • The move is planned to help the company maintain its Nasdaq listing. Share prices dropped below the $1 mark last December.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 20 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: XGTI +17%. CBAK-OLD +16%. MBLY +9%. IVAC +9%. SMI +7%.
    • Losers: OTC:FNCX -19%. MSDI -15%. LIVE -14%. FH -7%. INAP -7%.

  • MBLY

    Wells Fargo bullish on Mobileye-HERE deal indicators

    • Though noting necessity for better understanding of impact, analyst Richard KwasÂ suggests Mobileye and HERE's partnership on mapping technologies could serve as foundation to drive a future recurring revenue inflow and possibly foreshadow further Road Experience Management [REM] announcements, especially with various Mobileye presentations scheduled for CES next month, to come.
    • Maintains Outperform rating on Mobileye (NYSE:MBLY) shares, now toÂ 8.85% gainsÂ on the session at $38.12, with a $51-$53 target price range.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 9 Comments

  • KATE

    Bloomberg: Kate Spade commencing formal sale process next month

    • Citing interest drawn from six or so retailers and activist pressure Kate Spade's under, an official auction process is reportedly slated to begin next month with preparations underway through hired financial advisers.
    • Kate Spade (NYSE:KATE)Â +3.08%Â [5%+Â intraday from last hour].
    • Yesterday: Kate Spade +15.85%, sale exploration reported [updated]Â / Michael Kors, Coach rise intraday amid reports Kate Spade exploring sale
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM

  • IONS

    BMO raises Ionis target on Spinraza bullishness

    • With a fresh look at pricing and approval for spinal muscular atrophy drug Spinraza, BMO Capital is raising its price target for Ionis Pharmaceuticals (IONS -4.2%).
    • The FDA approved the treatment Friday and shares of Ionis and licensing partner Biogen (BIIB -0.7%) moved up that day.
    • BMO has boosted its price target on Ionis to $68 from $61, implying near-38% upside, as it expects broad adoption and some higher-than-expected prices.
    • “The gross annual cost of $750,000 for a new patient and $375,000 for maintenance exceeds our prior assumption of $300,000," says analyst Do Kim, who sees peak worldwide sales for the drug of $2.4B.
    • The firm also sees risk/reward for Ionis' Jan. 5 R&D update as "skewed to the upside" considering lower expectations for earlier pipeline drugs.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 19 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: KOOL +34%. FBIO +26%. ELGX +19%. PBMD +13%. SGNL +8%.
    • Losers: CEMP -56%. HIIQ -15%. GALE -11%. MBRX -9%. SBBP -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • MBLY

    Mobileye, HERE partner on location and mapping technologies

    • Merging the two parties' proficiencies involving autonomous driving, Mobileye's Roadbook will integrate with HERE HD Live Map, Mobileye will gain access to the HERE Open Location Platform and HERE will utilizeÂ raw sensor and observation data from Mobileye as the companies seek to jointly develop a top crowd-sourced HD mappingÂ offering for automakers.
    • Further opportunities for collaboration are noted to be explored.
    • Mobileye (NYSE:MBLY)Â +6%.
    • Earlier this week (December 27): More interest in mapping firm HERE
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 12 Comments
  • ELGX

    Endologix +2.6% as it resumes shipments of AFX device systems

    • Endologix (NASDAQ:ELGX) -- which fell on Tuesday as it decided to hold shipments on a medical device system -- is up 2.6% today after noting it resumed shipments and procedures on some of the products.
    • The company had held shipments of its AFX Endovascular AAA System to examine a manufacturing issue with some sizes of the product.
    • After testing, the company has removed the hold on all sizes of the AFX system and some sizes of the AFX2, clearing them for shipments and use in procedures. The company will continue testing remaining sizes of the AFX2.
    • It will hold a conference call to discuss the issue Friday at 9 a.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM

  • Galectin Therapeutics +20% as private placements set new funds

    • Galectin Therapeutics has moved up 20% premarket as it wraps a private placement of stock for $3M in new funding.
    • An existing investor and a new investor bought more than 2.81M shares of common stock above market, and got warrants for common stock exercisable at $5/share.
    • The company also closed a sale of series B-3 preferred stock for $1.008M in new proceeds.
    • The placements will "provide additional funding for our clinical programs, particularly our NASH-CX clinical trial," says CEO and CMO Dr. Peter Traber.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • IMMP

    Prima BioMed up 26% on melanoma treatment trial data

    • Prima BioMed (PBMD) is up 26.1% premarket after news of its first clinical data for a program combining its IMP321 with a PD-1 blocking antibody.
    • The combination is safe and well tolerated at the first dose level, the company says, and dose escalation can continue as it planned.
    • The results cane in its TACTI-mel trial. "Patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma that had suboptimal or no responses to Keytruda have been receiving IMP321 plus Keytruda to help boost their immune responses and increase the tumour response rate to Keytruda," the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • CEMP

    Cempra falls 48% pre-market on FDA response for Solithromycin

    • Cempra (CEMP) falls after FDA disapproves Solithromycin NDA in current form.
    • The letter states that the risk of hepatotoxicity had not been adequately characterized and the size of the safety database of 920 patients is too small to adequately characterize the nature and frequency of serious hepatic adverse effects.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 128 Comments
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings obtains secured standby letter of credit facility, +10% pre-market

    • Providing for an initial $200M figure and allowing for expansion, at request of Sears Holdings (SHLD), by an additional $300M.
    • The facility, supplied by affiliates of ESL Investments (managed by Sears CEO Edward Lampert) through Citibank as agent,Â enables increased liquidity for Sears to support operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 36 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: FBIO +40%. PHH +12%. ELGX +10%. SHLD +8%. PBMD +8%.
    • Losers: CEMP -48%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • SNH

    Senior Housing Properties Trust initiated with Overweight rating at Cantor Fitzgerald

    • Setting $23 target, firm cites robust senior housing market fundamentals and Senior Housing Properties Trust's (NYSE:SNH) lead positioning within the sector.
    • SharesÂ +0.88%Â pre-market at $18.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM | 10 Comments
  • TOSYY

    Toshiba plunges again after rating downgrades

    • Shares in Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSYY) closed down 17% overnight, clocking a third day of heavy losses following credit downgrades from both Moody's and S&P Global Ratings.
    • The conglomerate formally announced late on Tuesday that cost overruns at its U.S. nuclear business might result in "several billion dollars" in goodwill charges.
    • Since reports of the writedown, Toshiba shares have tanked 40%, erasing almost $7B in market value.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 AM | 3 Comments
